definition: to be well acquainted with/to know well

sentences.english: When was it that you got to know Teacher li?
sentences.chinese: 你到底何時同李教師熟識起來的？

sentences.english: One patient I knew became totally paralyzed overnight from a spinal cord infection.
sentences.chinese: 一位我熟識的病人由於脊髓感染一夜間癱瘓。

sentences.english: Up until now, what's her best-known role?
sentences.chinese: 截至目前，塔平最爲人所熟識的角色是誰？

sentences.english: Suddenly a pair of eyes met garrie's in recognition .
sentences.chinese: 冷不防有一雙熟識的眼睛和蓋莉對視了一下。

sentences.english: Suddenly a pair of eyes met Garrie's in recognition.
sentences.chinese: 冷不防有一雙熟識的眼睛和她對視了一下。

sentences.english: Remember that this is advice for becoming recognized in the field.
sentences.chinese: 記住，這只是個讓你在該領域爲人所熟識的建議。

sentences.english: Some people who know me well may be thinking “Really?
sentences.chinese: 一些熟識我的人或許會想“真的嗎？

sentences.english: He got reacquainted with his old college buddies.
sentences.chinese: 他再一次和他大學的老搭檔熟識。

definition: to have a special fondness (for sth)
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
in one's spare time/outside working hours/amateur (historian etc)
